html: 1.29.18  2:07 pm   Can you maybe lend a hand with this? I can sight read rhythms fine when it's just combinations of whole/half/quarter/8ths/16th notes (with rests or dots or ties or whatever)... But I get thrown off whenever triplets (or some kind of tuplet) comes in to play. I can clap out quarter note triplets or eighth note triplets over a click, but when it comes in the middle of a measure, or on an offbeat, or if there's only just one or two (instead of 3) of the triplets or if you have the triplets tied together with other notes, or a quarter note triplet paired with an eighth note triplet... all that kind of stuff just throws me off. I guess I kind of internalized the triplets in groups of 3 (three 8th note or 3 quarter note triplets in a line starting on the downbeat) and when they don't fall like that, I just can't feel the rhythm. Do you have any tips for how to count this stuff, or better yet just like how to internalize the feel of the notes to make them c ome more easy and natural? Ideally, I just want to get to the point where I can just feel it and play it naturally and don't have to be counting continuously in my head when trying to read. Just like when playing for fun, or making my own music I'm feeling the pulses of the bar, but I'm not counting all the subdivisions just letting the rhythms come naturally. I feel like I'm probably using all these tuplets a lot in my own playing and not even realizing when I'm doing it.
original_html: 1.29.18  2:07 pm   Can you maybe lend a hand with this? I can sight read rhythms fine when it's just combinations of whole/half/quarter/8ths/16th notes (with rests or dots or ties or whatever)... But I get thrown off whenever triplets (or some kind of tuplet) comes in to play. I can clap out quarter note triplets or eighth note triplets over a click, but when it comes in the middle of a measure, or on an offbeat, or if there's only just one or two (instead of 3) of the triplets or if you have the triplets tied together with other notes, or a quarter note triplet paired with an eighth note triplet... all that kind of stuff just throws me off. I guess I kind of internalized the triplets in groups of 3 (three 8th note or 3 quarter note triplets in a line starting on the downbeat) and when they don't fall like that, I just can't feel the rhythm. Do you have any tips for how to count this stuff, or better yet just like how to internalize the feel of the notes to make them c ome more easy and natural? Ideally, I just want to get to the point where I can just feel it and play it naturally and don't have to be counting continuously in my head when trying to read. Just like when playing for fun, or making my own music I'm feeling the pulses of the bar, but I'm not counting all the subdivisions just letting the rhythms come naturally. I feel like I'm probably using all these tuplets a lot in my own playing and not even realizing when I'm doing it.

html:
1.29.18  6:55 am   In 1.27.18  7:17 pm you mention making a list of things to change in your work. Do you get very critical over your own work? I'm having a lot of issues having that critical eye on what I'm doing. When I look at other people's work I have no issue finding the flaws, but when I look at mine? Impossible.  
Everything I've done, I've done for a reason so when I'm trying to look at my work I can't criticize it because of these reasons.  
How do you do?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201801271917

1.27.18  7:17 pm   What is your process for making a video?

     first figure out how it should go, then figure out how to make it go how i said it should go. then do what i said i should do to make it go how i think it should go. then look at it and freak out because it's not going how i thought it should go. then make a list of adjustments i can make to try to get it to go the way i want it to go. then do what it says on the list. then make another smaller list, and do that list. then make an even smaller list, and do what's on that list. then make an even smaller list and skip that list, and post it online
original_html:
1.29.18  6:55 am   In 1.27.18  7:17 pm you mention making a list of things to change in your work. Do you get very critical over your own work? I'm having a lot of issues having that critical eye on what I'm doing. When I look at other people's work I have no issue finding the flaws, but when I look at mine? Impossible.  
Everything I've done, I've done for a reason so when I'm trying to look at my work I can't criticize it because of these reasons.  
How do you do?

answers_original.html:
1.27.18  7:17 pm   What is your process for making a video?

     first figure out how it should go, then figure out how to make it go how i said it should go. then do what i said i should do to make it go how i think it should go. then look at it and freak out because it's not going how i thought it should go. then make a list of adjustments i can make to try to get it to go the way i want it to go. then do what it says on the list. then make another smaller list, and do that list. then make an even smaller list, and do what's on that list. then make an even smaller list and skip that list, and post it online
